p: Climate models provide global coverage for precipitation extremes [ 39•, 84] and more detailed coverage on regional scales [ 8•, 22, 36, 37]. They may be applied to different emissions scenarios or individual radiative forcings [ 18, 35•, 38], and they allow relatively straightforward investigations into the role of dynamics and other factors that contribute to precipitation intensity [ 24, 61•, 65, 83]. Important limitations in the ability of current models to simulate precipitation extremes have also been recognized and are related in part to the use of parameterized convection [ 38, 43, 58, 89, 93].
